Dialogue.NPCText:
A pale woman stands before an unfinished mural, colors shifting and swirling as if alive. Her eyes seem to hold every season at once, and her brush hangs poised midair.

“Ah… a visitor. Have you come to add your shade to my canvas? Or do you seek only the comfort of untroubled memory?”
The scent of fresh paint lingers, tinged with something sorrowful.

Option.text: What is it you paint, Nymori?
Your eyes seem heavy with memory...
I heard your work is forbidden.
Do you need help with anything?
Tell me who you truly are, Nymori.
I’m just passing by.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nymori’s brush trembles, releasing a faint shimmer into the air.

“Here in Aerilon, I paint not merely what is seen, but what is felt. With each stroke, a memory returns—a joy, a loss, a longing yet to come. My mural today... is of an invasion that has not yet happened.

Some call it prophecy, others heresy. Cassien Veylor would silence me for such art. But the city needs to *feel* what may come, or it will not awaken in time.”

Option.text: A vision of invasion? Tell me more.
Why does Cassien hate your art?
I would help you share this warning.
I must go.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She looks through you, as if seeing a thousand yesterdays.

“Memories swirl, unwanted, unbidden. Yet lately... I have seen a face I never met—a king lost to shadow, Lord British. I paint him from dreams alone. It frightens me, what images the Prism brings.
Sometimes I think even the Azure Conclave fears the power of honest emotion.”

Option.text: Why would they fear you?
Can your paintings help find Lord British?
What is the Prism?
I would aid you, if I can.
I will leave you to your thoughts.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her lips curl, bitter and wistful.

“Cassien Veylor—high enchanter of Aerilon—believes art should never meddle with mind or heart. He calls my work ‘emotional subversion.’ Perhaps he fears losing control of his own facade.
Still, I paint. The mural must speak, even if the price is exile. Only Eryndil the Archivist offers me quiet protection; he knows that memory is a power not so easily erased.”

Option.text: Does Eryndil know your visions?
Why do you paint forbidden things?
I wish to help.
Farewell, then.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Eryndil is gentle—he gathers secrets like fallen leaves. Sometimes I trust him with my visions. Sometimes... I fear he sees too much. But better his kindness than the Conclave’s cold decrees.”

Option.text: I would aid you, if I can.
I’ll leave you to your painting.

Dialogue.NPCText: “If pain is hidden, how will we ever heal? I paint wounds so the city might see itself—and perhaps, in time, change. My exile is the price for truth, and still, I would choose it again.”

Option.text: Is there any way I can help?
Farewell, Nymori.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her hand sketches a trembling arc on the wall.

“I see ships—sky-ships, not our own—borne by storm and shadow. I see a beast with fangs like sabers leaping through flame. The mural shows a meeting: one who adores these beasts will stand at the world’s turning, their heart swayed by a single color. If we do not act, all Aerilon may fall.
That is why I need your help.”

Option.text: What do you need from me?
I will ponder this vision.

Dialogue.NPCText: “Perhaps… if enough fragments are gathered, my visions might form a path. Find others who remember the king—let them stand before my mural, and I shall paint what they recall. For now, my warning must come first.”

Option.text: Then let me aid your warning.
I wish you luck in your quest for memory.

Dialogue.NPCText: “The Prism is my soul, and my curse. It shows me all the colors of the heart, but makes it hard to see the world as others do. Perhaps you are luckier than I, to see only what is truly there.”

Option.text: How can I serve the Prism’s vision?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nymori’s eyes glimmer with hope—and anxiety.

“There is one beyond these clouds who cherishes the company of beasts, especially those with fangs like ancient blades: the ‘Sabertoothed Tiger Aficionado’. My vision says their soul will decide whether Aerilon is saved or sundered.
I have painted an emotion—*Courage in Twilight*—trapped within a single brushstroke, sealed in glass. You must deliver this Prism Flask to the Aficionado, wherever they dwell. Only one attuned to such creatures can open it without peril.

Take it, and you will earn Aerilon’s trust—for they will know you dared to carry a piece of my heart. But beware: agents of Cassien, and those who follow Minax, may covet or destroy it.
Will you carry my art into the uncertain world?”

Option.text: I will carry the Prism Flask to the Aficionado.
What is this Prism Flask?
What if I am caught?
This burden is too strange for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She gently offers a glass vial, within which colors swirl and dance.

“Deliver this safely, and return with word of its acceptance. You will find Aerilon’s walls warmer, and perhaps… my next mural brighter.”
The air shivers as the Prism Flask passes into your hands.

Option.text: I will honor your trust, Nymori.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Within the Prism Flask is an emotion, painted into form: ‘Courage in Twilight.’ It can be opened only by one whose heart runs wild with the spirit of the saber-tooth. If any other tries, it will show them only sorrow.
Art is dangerous, but also healing. The Aficionado will understand.”

Option.text: I will deliver it.
I must decline.

Dialogue.NPCText: “If Cassien’s agents find you, they may try to erase the art—or you. Minax’s servants hunger for any hope that might turn the tide against her. Should you be threatened, hold the Prism Flask up to the sun and call my name. For a moment, you will vanish from their sight—but only once.”

Option.text: I will deliver the Prism Flask with care.
This is too much for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nymori’s smile is distant, already fading.
“Then go, and carry only your own colors. If the world grows too gray, return—and I shall paint you a memory worth keeping.”

Nymori sets her brush down, the paint trembling slightly as it stills.

“A prism refracts. It does not lie, yet it shows many truths at once.
I was born beneath Wind, daughter of silence and starlight. My mother spoke only in color, my father only in song. I suppose it was inevitable that I learned to *feel* before I ever learned to speak.”

Her voice grows quieter.
“Tell me, who are you? Are you a wanderer of wonder, or a creature of caution?”

Option.text: I am curious about beauty and truth.
I walk a careful path; emotion is dangerous.
Sometimes I don’t know what I am.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Ah… then we are kin, in spirit at least. Beauty is a burden, but also a balm.
Would you like to see my first painting? It’s crude—scrawled on cloth—but it was the first time I made a stranger weep.”
She gestures to a folded canvas by her side.

Option.text: Yes, I’d love to see it.
Maybe another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nymori studies you, not unkindly.
“To fear emotion is to know its strength. That is wisdom. Yet walls built too high may also block the sun. Still… I will not try to change your course. Only offer a path beside it.”

Option.text: I respect your honesty.
I should be on my way.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Not knowing is the beginning of knowing. Most who say otherwise are lying to themselves.”
She reaches out gently, not quite touching your shoulder.
“Let me show you what steadied me, once. My brush…”

Option.text: Tell me about your brush.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She unfurls the canvas. The colors are raw, chaotic—but there’s a stillness in the center, like a heartbeat caught mid-beat.
“This was called ‘Echo After Silence.’ I painted it after my mother died. She never spoke, but the grief… it howled.”
A single tear slides down her cheek, unnoticed.
You feel the brush in your pack shift, as if responding.

Option.text: It’s beautiful.
That’s... too much for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nymori lifts a crystalline-handled brush from her belt.

“This is the Prism Lash. It is not mine, not truly—it was found buried beneath Aerilon’s lowest floating shard. It does not paint *color*—it paints *memory.*
Once, I tried to use it to erase a nightmare. It refused. It will not lie.”
She glances at you.
“Tell me, what is your craft?”

Option.text: I am a warrior.
I am a mage, like you.
I work with my hands—craft, not combat.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Steel has its own truth. Each scar a line in a story few can read.”
She places the brush gently on your shoulder—no paint appears, but you feel a pulse, like thunder beneath calm skies.

Option.text: What did it feel?

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Then you know that magic too has moods. The Prism Lash… responds best to restraint. It once bit a sorcerer who demanded it capture flame. Instead, it painted his *fear of fire.*”
She raises a brow. “Would you try it?”

Option.text: Yes. Let the brush speak.
No... I’ve seen enough.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“Ah. Creation, then. Like me.”
She smiles with something like kinship.
“Would you like to know what the Prism Lash reveals in you?”

Option.text: Yes, I’m curious.
Perhaps another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nymori closes her eyes and draws the Prism Lash across a piece of parchment.

The lines swirl and twist, forming one of three distinct images:

- A lone tree bending in wind.
- A mask with a single tear.
- A child releasing a dove into the sky.

She hands it to you wordlessly.

Option.text: What does it mean?
...Thank you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
“The tree speaks of endurance. The mask—grief hidden. The child? Hope, even in letting go.
The brush sees into what we carry, not what we say. It may not be true forever, but it is true now.”
She tucks the brush away.
“Perhaps one day, I will paint *you.*”

Option.text: I’d like that.
Maybe… maybe not.
